title: Grocery store sales at two locations

content.question: A grocery store wants to examine the relationship between the sales amounts each day at two different locations, store A and store B. The sales amount each day, in dollars, was recorded for 10 days at each store. The least-squares regression line is <math alttext="y hat equals, negative 3,000 plus 1.2 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the sales amounts each day at store A and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the sales amounts each day at store B. If the mean of the 10 sales amounts for store B is $45,000, what is the mean of the 10 sales amounts for store A?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
